definition: to shove/to jostle
to push/to cut/to refuse/to reject/to decline/to shirk (responsibility)/to put off/to delay/to push forward/to nominate/to elect/massage
push back/push over
to push and shove

sentences.english: Or a juggler hates a shove.
The wine-sellers elbow their way through the crowd with great black skins on their shoulders.
sentences.chinese: 酒販子肩上扛着黑色大皮簍在人羣裏推搡着前進。
瑪麗從人羣中推推搡搡地擠過去。

sentences.english: There, Ms. Li jostled with police trying to prevent their protest.
sentences.chinese: 在那裏，李正芳與試圖阻止他們抗議的警察發生推搡。

sentences.english: People were pushing and shoving toward the train.
sentences.chinese: 人們推推搡搡擠向火車。

sentences.english: A penalty kick may be an appropriate penalty for shoving and grabbing inside the box.
sentences.chinese: 對於禁區內的推搡和拉拽點球也許是個恰當的處罰。

sentences.english: She barged her way through a crowd.
sentences.chinese: 她推推搡搡地穿過人羣。

sentences.english: Everybody was pushing and shoving towards the exit.
sentences.chinese: 大家都在推推搡搡向出口擠去。

sentences.english: He crowded the child off the sidewalk.
sentences.chinese: 他把小孩從人行便道上推搡下去了。

sentences.english: Gone are the sweaty officials and greasy baggage handlers of yore, the taxi touts and shoving crowds.
sentences.chinese: 官方顧客和昔日推推搡搡的人羣處理油膩行李。

sentences.english: The youths jostled (against) an old lady on the pavement.
sentences.chinese: 那些青年人在人行道上推推搡搡擠著了一個老太太。

sentences.english: He had no choice but to jam his way through the crowd.
sentences.chinese: 他別無選擇，只得推推搡搡擠出人羣。

sentences.english: Others joshed loudly and wrestled with each other.
sentences.chinese: 其他人大聲說說笑笑，互相推搡。

sentences.english: Some even resort to physical abuse, like spitting, shoving, or punching.
sentences.chinese: 有些人甚至開始用起手來，互相吐唾沫，推推搡搡。

sentences.english: They do not push. They wait in line.
sentences.chinese: 他們不推推搡搡，安靜排隊。

sentences.english: Some blokes got stuck into him for spilling someone's drink.
sentences.chinese: 一幫傢伙就因爲他打翻了別人的酒而推搡了他。

definition: to push and shove
to fight together/to come to blows
to wrestle/to grapple/to scuffle
to chase and beat
physical encounter/fight
to beat up/to come to blows/battery (law)
to try to stop a fight/to intervene in a fight
to mediate in a quarrel/to intervene in a dispute and try to calm things down
lit. to punch and kick (idiom); to beat up/fig. determined to sort out a problem
push back/push over
to square off/to exchange blows/to rain blows on sb
to dispute/to disagree/to argue opinionatedly/to wrangle
to verbally abuse
to collide/jerking motion/to impinge/to offend/to provoke
to insult/to revile/abuse/vituperation
to berate/to excoriate/to chide/also written 喝斥[he1 chi4]
